title: EUR/USD Price Forecast – Euro continues to look soft
text:
The Euro fell a bit to kick off the trading session on Friday but then rallied significantly, only to turn around and give back some of the gains. It’s obvious that the Euro is more than likely going to continue drifting lower, as we have seen such significant selling pressure over the longer-term. Granted, it’s been a very choppy ride lower but it does make sense that we continue to see negativity based on the fact that bond yields in the European Union are almost all negative at this point so therefore it makes more sense to put money in the United States for larger institutions. Beyond that, we also have to worry about Germany going into recession as it is hanging on by a thread, and of course Italy is already there.

EUR/USD Video 30.09.19

To the downside, breaking below the 1.09 level would be the next trigger for fresh money coming into the downside, pressing toward the 100% Fibonacci retracement level which is closer to the 1.04 handle. Granted, it’s going to take forever to get there, because this pair doesn’t necessarily move that quick. That being said though, I do expect to see back-and-forth trading and an opportunity to fade rallies every time they appear. Simple patience will be needed to take advantage of the market once it’s gone a little too far to the upside as the trend and all of the reasons for it are still firmly ensconced.

Please let us know what you think in the comments below

This article was originally posted on FX Empire

More From FXEMPIRE:
description: The Euro rallied a bit during the trading session after initially falling on Friday, but has turned around to give back quite a bit of the gains already. In other words, this looks like a market that is certainly going to eventually go lower, and the fundamentals would suggest that should be the case
